sn52.5:4.3: “Reverend Anuruddha, what things should a mendicant who is a master enter and remain in?”
sn52.5:4.4: “Reverend Sāriputta, a mendicant who is a master should enter and remain in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.5:4.6: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.5:4.7: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn52.5:4.9: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.5:4.10: A mendicant who is a master should enter and remain in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
